// Build dynamic schema: unique keys across all supplier objects
// Normalize rows for the table in the same column order
// For objects like reference links, create a readable string
const country = (countryRaw === null || typeof countryRaw === 'undefined' || countryRaw === '') ? 'Unknown' : String(countryRaw);
// Visualizer template with table and bar chart
body { font-family: -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; }
th, td { border: 1px solid #ddd; padding: 6px; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; }

request.description:
Get Suppliers (ServiceNow Table API: sn_fin_supplier)

Overview: Retrieves supplier records from the ServiceNow sn_fin_supplier table using the Table API. Supports filtering, sorting, pagination, and field selection via query parameters.

Authentication: Requires an x-sn-apikey header valid for the illumindev ServiceNow instance. Ensure the active environment stores sensitive values securely.

Base URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/sn_fin_supplier

Common query parameters:
- sysparm_query: Encoded query to filter records (e.g., nameLIKEAcme^active=true)
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return (e.g., sys_id,name,active)
- sysparm_limit: Max records to return (default 10, max depends on instance)
- sysparm_offset: Record index to start from (for pagination)
- sysparm_orderby / sysparm_orderby_desc: Sort results
- sysparm_display_value: true | false | all (resolve reference fields)
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true | false (suppress reference links)
- sysparm_no_count: true | false (skip total count for performance)

Usage examples:
- Get first 25 suppliers with key fields:
  GET …/sn_fin_supplier?sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,active&sysparm_limit=25
- Filter active suppliers named like "Acme", sorted by name:
  GET …/sn_fin_supplier?sysparm_query=nameLIKEAcme^active=true&sysparm_orderby=name&sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,active

Success response shape:
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<guid>",
      "name": "<string>",
      "active": true,
      "...": "other fields"
    }
  ]
}

Errors:
- 401/403: Invalid or missing API key. Verify x-sn-apikey.
- 400: Malformed sysparm_query or invalid parameter value.
- 429: Rate limited—retry with backoff.

Notes:
- Use variables for sensitive values: set x-sn-apikey in an environment variable.
- For large datasets, paginate with sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset.
- Respect instance ACLs; fields may be omitted based on permissions.

request.description:
Title: Get Purchase Orders (ServiceNow)

Summary: Retrieves purchase orders from the ServiceNow Table API for the sn_shop_purchase_order table.

Base URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com
Endpoint: /api/now/table/sn_shop_purchase_order
Method: GET

Authentication: API Key (x-sn-apikey header). Ensure the x-sn-apikey value is set in the active environment or request header.

Headers:
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (recommended to store as an environment variable)
- Accept: application/json (optional)

Query Parameters:
- sysparm_query (string, optional): Encoded query to filter results. Example: sysparm_query=state%3Dactive
- sysparm_limit (number, optional): Max records to return. Default 100. Example: sysparm_limit=50
- sysparm_offset (number, optional): Records to skip for pagination. Example: sysparm_offset=100
- sysparm_fields (string, optional): Comma-separated list of fields to return. Example: sysparm_fields=number,state,vendor,short_description
- sysparm_display_value (string, optional): none|true|all. Return display values. Example: sysparm_display_value=all
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link (boolean, optional): true|false. Exclude reference links in response. Example: sysparm_exclude_reference_link=true
- sysparm_no_count (boolean, optional): true|false. Skip total count for performance. Example: sysparm_no_count=true
- sysparm_query_category (string, optional): Query category name if configured.
- sysparm_view (string, optional): View to determine fields and formats.

Examples:
- Get first 50 POs: ?sysparm_limit=50
- Active POs with selected fields: ?sysparm_query=state%3Dactive&sysparm_fields=number,state,vendor,total_cost
- Paginate to next page: ?sysparm_limit=100&sysparm_offset=100

Sample cURL:
```
curl -X GET \
  'https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/sn_shop_purchase_order?sysparm_limit=50&sysparm_display_value=all' \
  -H 'x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'
```

Success Response (200):
```
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<guid>",
      "number": "PO0012345",
      "state": "active",
      "vendor": "<sys_id or display>",
      "total_cost": 1234.56,
      "sys_created_on": "2025-01-01 12:00:00",
      "...": "other fields from sn_shop_purchase_order"
    }
  ]
}
```

Error Responses:
- 401 Unauthorized: Invalid/missing API key.
- 403 Forbidden: Insufficient permissions to read sn_shop_purchase_order.
- 404 Not Found: Table not found or restricted.
- 429 Too Many Requests: Rate limiting in effect.
- 5xx Server Error: ServiceNow instance error.

Notes:
- Use pagination via sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset for large datasets.
- Prefer returning only needed fields via sysparm_fields to reduce payload size.
- For reference fields, set sysparm_display_value=all to get both raw and display values.
- This request has no body.

Get Purchase Order Lines

Summary
Retrieves purchase order line records from ServiceNow’s sn_shop_purchase_order_line table. This request supports filtering and pagination using standard Table API query parameters.

Endpoint
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/sn_shop_purchase_order_line

Authentication
This request uses an API key header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}. Ensure the active environment provides a valid value.

Query Parameters (common Table API params)
- sysparm_query: ServiceNow encoded query to filter results. Example: number=POL0001033
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return. Example: number,product_name,purchase_order,sys_updated_on
- sysparm_limit: Max records to return (default 10, max depends on instance). Example: 50
- sysparm_offset: Record index to start from for pagination.
- sysparm_display_value: true | false | all – controls reference field display values.
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true | false – omit reference links in payload.
- sysparm_suppress_pagination_header: true | false – hide pagination headers.

Headers
- x-sn-apikey: API key (provided via active environment).
- Accept: application/json (implicit).

Success Response
- Status: 200 OK
- Body: JSON with result array of purchase order line objects.
Example fields observed: number, product_name, purchased_quantity, remaining_quantity, purchase_order (reference), business_owner (reference), sys_id, sys_updated_on, active, line_source, product_type, etc.

Example
GET .../api/now/table/sn_shop_purchase_order_line?sysparm_query=number=POL0001033&sysparm_fields=number,product_name,purchase_order,sys_updated_on

Notes
- Use sysparm_fields to reduce payload size.
- For reference fields, set sysparm_display_value=all to include both value and display name.
- Combine filters with ^ (AND) and ^OR (OR) in sysparm_query.
- Respect instance rate limits and pagination using sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset.

Troubleshooting
- 401/403: Verify x-sn-apikey is valid and has permissions to the table.
- 400: Check sysparm_query syntax and field names.
- Empty result: Confirm filters match existing records.

Overview
Retrieves currency instance records from ServiceNow table fx_currency2_instance.

Method and URL
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/fx_currency2_instance

Auth and Headers
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (required)
- Accept: application/json (recommended)

Query Parameters
- sysparm_limit (optional): Maximum number of records to return. Example: 200
- sysparm_display_value (optional): Return display values. true | false. Example: true

Example
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/fx_currency2_instance?sysparm_limit=200&sysparm_display_value=true
Header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Sample cURL
curl --location --request GET 'https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/fx_currency2_instance?sysparm_limit=200&sysparm_display_value=true' \
  --header 'x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'

Successful Response (200)
Body shape
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "string",
      "table": "string",
      "parent_record": { "value": "string", "link": "string" },
      "field": "string",
      "currency": "string",
      "amount": "string",
      "reference_currency": "string",
      "reference_amount": "string",
      "conversion_rate": "string",
      "sys_created_on": "YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss",
      "sys_created_by": "string",
      "sys_updated_on": "YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss",
      "sys_updated_by": "string"
    }
  ]
}

Notes
- Use environment variable {{x-sn-apikey}} from the active environment.
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts; consider adding tests for status=200 and non-empty result if needed.
- Saved examples in this request illustrate typical responses.

request.description:
Purpose
Fetch ServiceNow Supplier Products from the sn_shop_supplier_product table. This GET endpoint returns product records for suppliers, supporting filtering, field selection, pagination, and display value customization.

Authentication
- Header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}
- Recommendation: store the API key in an active environment variable named x-sn-apikey and reference it as {{x-sn-apikey}}. Do not hardcode secrets in requests or code.

Base URL
https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/sn_shop_supplier_product

Query parameters
- sysparm_query: ServiceNow encoded query to filter results.
  • Example: sysparm_query=active=true^product_type=good
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return.
  • Example: sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,product_type,supplier,uom
- sysparm_limit: Maximum number of records to return (default per instance; commonly 10).
  • Example: sysparm_limit=50
- sysparm_offset: Number of records to skip for pagination.
  • Example: sysparm_offset=100
- sysparm_display_value: Return display values for reference fields.
  • Values: true | false | all
  • Example: sysparm_display_value=true
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: Exclude reference link URLs from response.
  • Values: true | false
  • Example: sysparm_exclude_reference_link=true

Usage examples
1) Get active goods, select key fields, with display values
GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/sn_shop_supplier_product?sysparm_query=active=true^product_type=good&sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,product_type,supplier,uom&sysparm_display_value=true&sysparm_limit=25

2) Paginate through all products (offset/limit)
GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/sn_shop_supplier_product?sysparm_limit=100&sysparm_offset=200

3) Search by supplier and partial name
GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/sn_shop_supplier_product?sysparm_query=supplier=8f255b0d87fc3650dbd2fc89cebb358f^nameLIKETEST

Sample responses
Success (200)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "782ad58d87097210dbd2fc89cebb35c1",
      "name": "TEST3",
      "product_type": "good",
      "supplier": {"value": "8f255b0d87fc3650dbd2fc89cebb358f"},
      "uom": {"value": "51a74add0f233300fee7579ac4767e59"},
      "active": "true"
    }
  ]
}

Error (401 Unauthorized)
{
  "error": {
    "message": "User Not Authenticated",
    "detail": "Required x-sn-apikey header missing or invalid"
  },
  "status": "failure"
}

Error (400 Bad Request)
{
  "error": {
    "message": "Invalid query",
    "detail": "sysparm_query: unknown field 'foo'"
  },
  "status": "failure"
}

Testing tips
- Add tests to assert 200 status, array presence, and schema of key fields:
  pm.test("status is 200", () => pm.response.to.have.status(200));
  const json = pm.response.json();
  pm.expect(json.result).to.be.an("array");
- Validate pagination by requesting a small sysparm_limit and checking result length.
- Use {{x-sn-apikey}} from the active environment. Confirm the header is present in the Headers tab.
- Save a successful response as an example to power a mock, if needed.

Notes

request.description:
Title: Get Active Companies (core_company)

Summary: Retrieves active company records from the ServiceNow core_company table.

Details:

- Method: GET
    
- URL: [https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/core_company](https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/core_company)
    
- Authentication: API key via header x-sn-apikey. Ensure the active environment provides the correct value.
    

Query parameters used in this request:

- sysparm_query=active=true — returns only active companies
    
- sysparm_fields=sys_id,supplier,name — limits fields in the response
    

Optional parameters you can add:

- sysparm_limit=10 — limit number of returned records (default is instance-specific)
    

Successful response: 200 OK with a JSON body containing an array of company records with fields sys_id, supplier, and name.

Notes:

- Requires appropriate permissions on the instance.
    
- Use additional sysparm_\* parameters as needed (e.g., sysparm_query to add more conditions).

Overview
Retrieve users from the ServiceNow sys_user table using the ServiceNow Table API.

HTTP
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user

What this endpoint does
- Returns a list of user records (or a single record when filtered) from the sys_user table.
- Supports filtering, field selection, and pagination via query parameters.

Authentication and headers
- Required header for this request: x-sn-apikey: <your_api_key>
  - This request is configured to send x-sn-apikey. Do not paste secrets in the docs.
- Other ServiceNow auth options (not used here): Basic Auth or OAuth 2.0 depending on your instance setup.

Query parameters (commonly used)
- sysparm_query: ServiceNow encoded query string used to filter records.
  - Examples:
    - sysparm_query=user_name=Ahmed
    - sysparm_query=user_name=ahmed.donia
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return.
  - Example: sysparm_fields=sys_id,user_name,name,email
- sysparm_limit: Maximum number of records to return (default may vary by instance; often 10).
  - Example: sysparm_limit=50
- sysparm_offset: Number of records to skip (use with limit for pagination).
  - Example: sysparm_offset=100

Pagination tips (ServiceNow Table API)
- Use sysparm_limit to control page size and sysparm_offset to move through pages.
- Typical pattern:
  - First page: sysparm_limit=50&sysparm_offset=0
  - Next page: sysparm_limit=50&sysparm_offset=50
- Some instances support Link headers or provide result counts; when not available, track offsets client-side.

Sample requests
- Get users with username "Ahmed" (limit fields and page size):
  GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/sys_user?sysparm_query=user_name=Ahmed&sysparm_fields=sys_id,user_name,name,email&sysparm_limit=25

- Get a specific username with pagination window:
  GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/sys_user?sysparm_query=user_name=ahmed.donia&sysparm_limit=1&sysparm_offset=0

Sample response (truncated example)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "a1b2c3d4e5f6a7b8c9d0e1f2a3b4c5d6",
      "user_name": "ahmed.donia",
      "name": "Ahmed Donia",
      "email": "ahmed.donia@example.com"
    }
  ]
}

Response structure expectations
- Successful responses include a JSON object with a top-level "result" key.
- "result" is an array of records; each record contains fields from sys_user corresponding to your sysparm_fields selection (or all readable fields when none specified).
- Error responses typically include HTTP status codes 4xx/5xx and may contain a structured error object.

Troubleshooting
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden: Verify x-sn-apikey is valid and active for this instance. If your instance requires Basic/OAuth, configure auth at the request or folder/collection level instead of the API key header.
- 400 Bad Request: Check sysparm_query syntax (encoded queries must follow ServiceNow query rules). Validate field names in sysparm_fields.
- Empty result set: Confirm the filter criteria (sysparm_query) matches existing users and that the calling user has rights to read sys_user.
- Pagination confusion: Ensure sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset are integers and advance offset by the limit for the next page.

Notes
- Do not include secrets in documentation or examples. Replace sensitive values with placeholders.
- This request is read-only and does not modify data.

Retrieve a list of vendor/company records from ServiceNow's core_company table.

Base URL
- https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/core_company

What this request does
- Performs a read (GET) on the core_company table to return company/vendor records.
- Returns data in JSON format using the ServiceNow Table API.

Authentication
- x-sn-apikey (header) is required for this instance. Ensure this header is present and valid.

Headers
- x-sn-apikey: Your ServiceNow API key for the illumindev instance.
- Accept: application/json (optional)
- Content-Type: application/json (not required for GET)

Query parameters
- sysparm_limit (optional): Maximum number of records to return. Common values: 1, 10. Default per instance settings if omitted. Example: ?sysparm_limit=10
- You can add standard ServiceNow Table API parameters as needed, such as:
  - sysparm_query: Encoded query to filter results (e.g., nameSTARTSWITHAcme).
  - sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return (e.g., name,sys_id,active).
  - sysparm_offset: Record offset for pagination.
  - sysparm_display_value: true|all|false to control display values.

Example usage
- Get first 10 vendors: GET /api/now/table/core_company?sysparm_limit=10
- Get a single vendor by name: GET /api/now/table/core_company?sysparm_query=name%3DAcme
- Return specific fields: GET /api/now/table/core_company?sysparm_fields=name,sys_id,active&sysparm_limit=10

Pagination
- Use sysparm_limit to control page size and sysparm_offset to fetch subsequent pages.

Response
- 200 OK: Array of core_company records with fields per your query.
- 4xx/5xx: Error details with status and message.

Notes
- Do not include a body for this GET request.
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts; consider adding tests to validate status code and response structure if needed.

Purpose
Retrieve contract records from ServiceNow’s ast_contract table.

HTTP
- Method: GET
- Path: /api/now/table/ast_contract
- Base URL example: https://<instance>.service-now.com

Required header
- x-sn-apikey: <masked_api_key>  // Set via environment or collection auth if available. Do not hardcode sensitive values.

Optional query parameters
- sysparm_query: Filter results using ServiceNow encoded queries.
  • Examples:
    - active=true
    - vendor=53dd2416877d5a10dbd2fc89cebb35ae^active=true
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return.
  • Examples:
    - sys_id,vendor
    - sys_id,vendor,supplier
- sysparm_limit: Maximum number of records to return.
  • Examples: 10, 100

Typical responses
- 200 OK: Returns JSON with result array of contract objects.
  • Example fields (not exhaustive):
    - sys_id, number, short_description, vendor, supplier, starts, ends, renewal_date, renewal_end_date, active, payment_schedule, yearly_cost, monthly_cost, license_type, state, substate, sys_updated_on
- 4xx/5xx: Error response with status and message.

Sample requests
1) Get active contracts (default fields)
GET https://<instance>.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract?sysparm_query=active=true

2) Get vendor and supplier for first 10 active contracts
GET https://<instance>.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract?sysparm_query=active=true&sysparm_fields=sys_id,vendor,supplier&sysparm_limit=10

3) Get contracts for a specific vendor (replace with your vendor sys_id)
GET https://<instance>.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract?sysparm_query=vendor=<vendor_sys_id>^active=true&sysparm_fields=sys_id,number,short_description,starts,ends

Notes
- Use the Params tab to add/modify query parameters.
- Keep API keys and tokens in environments; avoid storing them in request descriptions or examples.
- This request has no body, pre-request script, or tests by default.

Overview
Retrieves a single ServiceNow Contract (ast_contract) record by sys_id. Useful for reading contract metadata such as number, vendor, term dates, payment schedule, and costs.

Method & URL
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract/{sys_id}

Authentication
This endpoint requires an API key header.
- Header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Path Parameters
- sys_id (string, required): The unique sys_id of the ast_contract record to fetch.

Query Parameters
Common ServiceNow table API parameters may be used (optional):
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return.
- sysparm_display_value: true|false|all to control display values.
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true|false to hide reference links.
- sysparm_suppress_pagination_header: true|false.

Headers
- x-sn-apikey: Your ServiceNow API key. Consider storing it in the active environment variable {{x-sn-apikey}}.

Successful Response
Status: 200 OK
Body: { "result": { ...contract fields... } }
Key fields commonly returned (example from last successful run):
- number (string): Contract number, e.g., CNTR0010067
- short_description (string): Brief contract description
- description (string): Detailed description
- starts (date): Contract start date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- ends (date): Contract end date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- state (string): Contract state, e.g., draft
- substate (string): Substate, e.g., awaiting_review
- active (boolean): Whether the contract is active
- payment_schedule (string): e.g., Annual
- invoice_payment_terms (string): e.g., net_30
- yearly_cost (number): e.g., 40000
- monthly_cost (number): e.g., 3333.3333
- lifetime_cost (number)
- total_cost (number)
- vendor (reference): sys_id of vendor
- supplier (reference): sys_id of supplier
- cost_center (reference): sys_id of cost center
- approver (reference): sys_id of approver
- sys_id (string)

Error Responses
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid sys_id or parameters.
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden: Missing or invalid API key.
- 404 Not Found: No contract found for given sys_id.

Example
Request:
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract/c407543287b9da10dbd2fc89cebb35f5
Headers:
  x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Sample 200 Response (truncated):
{
  "result": {
    "number": "CNTR0010067",
    "short_description": "Saleo Platform Fee: Mid-Market Package",
    "starts": "2022-11-29",
    "ends": "2028-11-29",
    "yearly_cost": "40000",
    "monthly_cost": "3333.3333",
    "vendor_contract": "S-1",
    "state": "draft",
    "substate": "awaiting_review",
    "sys_id": "c407543287b9da10dbd2fc89cebb35f5"
  }
}

Notes
- To limit payload size, use sysparm_fields to request only the fields you need.
- Use sysparm_display_value=true if you want human-readable reference values.
- This request currently has no tests; consider adding assertions for status 200 and presence of key fields (number, sys_id).

Overview
Retrieve a specific Contract (ast_contract) record from ServiceNow by sys_id.

Method & URL
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract/{sys_id}

Path parameters
- sys_id (string, required): Unique identifier of the contract record to fetch.

Headers
- x-sn-apikey (string, required): API key for authentication. You can store this in an environment variable and reference it as {{x-sn-apikey}}.
- Accept: application/json (optional)

Authentication
This endpoint uses the x-sn-apikey header. Ensure your active environment contains the variable for the API key, or paste the key directly.

Query parameters
None.

Request body
Not applicable.

Response
- 200 OK: Returns a JSON object representing the ast_contract record.
- 401/403: Authentication or authorization failure. Verify x-sn-apikey.
- 404: No contract found for the provided sys_id.

Sample request
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract/{{MY_SYS_ID}}
Headers:
  x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}
  Accept: application/json

Sample success response (truncated)
{
  "result": {
    "sys_id": "<uuid>",
    "number": "CNT0001234",
    "short_description": "Example contract",
    "state": "active"
    // other ast_contract fields...
  }
}

Error response example
{
  "error": {
    "message": "Access denied",
    "detail": "Required to provide valid API key"
  },
  "status": "failure"
}

Notes
- This request expects a valid sys_id from the ast_contract table.
- Use the environment variable {{MY_SYS_ID}} to quickly switch between records.
- Consider adding tests to assert status 200 and presence of result.sys_id.

Overview
Retrieve expense lines from ServiceNow’s Table API. This request targets the fm_expense_line table and returns expense line records.

Endpoint
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/fm_expense_line

Authentication & Headers
- x-sn-apikey: Required. API key with permissions to read fm_expense_line.
- Accept: application/json (default returned by the Table API).

Usage
- Send as-is to fetch the latest records (ServiceNow returns paginated results).
- Use query parameters to filter, sort, and page results (see below).

Common Query Parameters
- sysparm_query: Encoded Glide query to filter records. Example: sysparm_query=state%3Dprocessed%5Eexpense_type%3Dopex
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated field list to limit returned fields. Example: sysparm_fields=number,date,amount,state,sys_id
- sysparm_limit: Max number of records to return (default 10, max depends on instance settings). Example: sysparm_limit=50
- sysparm_offset: Record offset for pagination. Example: sysparm_offset=50
- sysparm_display_value: true|all|false – include display values. Example: sysparm_display_value=true
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true|false – remove reference links in response.
- sysparm_query_no_domain: true|false – ignore domain separation (requires rights).

Examples
- Filter processed OPEX lines limited to 25 records:
  ?sysparm_query=state%3Dprocessed%5Eexpense_type%3Dopex&sysparm_limit=25
- Request specific fields with display values:
  ?sysparm_fields=number,date,amount,state,sys_id&sysparm_display_value=true

Sample Response (truncated)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "number": "EXP0011080",
      "sys_id": "0409aa991b09ba508d5f64e1604bcb87",
      "date": "2025-11-05",
      "amount": "19.7",
      "state": "processed",
      "expense_type": "opex"
      // ... additional fields omitted
    }
  ]
}

Notes
- Pagination: Combine sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset to iterate through pages.
- Performance: Prefer sysparm_fields to reduce payload size.
- Security: Do not commit or share your API key. Consider storing it in an environment variable (e.g., {{x-sn-apikey}}) and referencing it in the header.
- Errors: 401/403 indicate auth/ACL issues. 429 indicates rate limiting; back off and retry.

# Get Contracts (ServiceNow)

Retrieves active contract records from the ServiceNow table `ast_contract`.

- Method: GET
- URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract

Query parameters:
- sysparm_query (string, optional): ServiceNow encoded query. Default used here: `active=true` to return only active contracts.
- sysparm_fields (string, optional): Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. Example: `sys_id,vendor,supplier`.
- sysparm_limit (number, optional): Maximum number of records to return. Example: `10`.

Headers:
- x-sn-apikey (string, required): API key for authentication. Recommended to store this in an environment variable and reference it as `{{x-sn-apikey}}`.

Example request:
```
GET /api/now/table/ast_contract?sysparm_query=active=true&sysparm_fields=sys_id,vendor,supplier
Host: illumindev.service-now.com
x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}
```

Success response (200):
```
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "...",
      "vendor": { "value": "...", "link": "..." },
      "supplier": { "value": "...", "link": "..." }
    },
    ...
  ]
}
```

Notes:
- The `vendor` and `supplier` fields are references; the `value` is the sys_id of the related record.
- Use `sysparm_limit` to page results; combine with `sysparm_query` for filtering.
- Do not include a request body for GET requests.

request.description:
Summary
Retrieves Configuration Item (CI) records from the ServiceNow CMDB via the Table API.

Endpoint
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/cmdb_ci

Auth
This request uses an API key header: `x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}`. Ensure the active environment provides a valid key.

Querying
Use standard ServiceNow Table API query parameters to filter and page results, for example:
- sysparm_query: Glide query to filter CIs (e.g., `sysparm_query=sys_class_name=cmdb_ci_computer`)
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated fields to return
- sysparm_limit: Max records to return (default 10,000 if not specified by instance settings)
- sysparm_offset: Offset for pagination
- sysparm_display_value: Return display values (`true`, `false`, or `all`)

Response
Returns a JSON object with a `result` array of CI records. Example fields include `sys_id`, `name`, `sys_class_name`, `install_status`, `assigned_to`, etc.

Notes
- No request body is required for GET.
- To retrieve a specific CI class, filter by `sys_class_name`.
- Respect instance ACLs and rate limits when adding pagination.

Troubleshooting
- 401/403: Verify `{{x-sn-apikey}}` in the active environment and required roles.
- 400: Check `sysparm_query` syntax.
- 429: Back off and paginate using `sysparm_limit` and `sysparm_offset`.

Summary
Retrieve asset records from ServiceNow's alm_asset table.

Base URL
https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/alm_asset

Method
GET

Auth
API Key via header x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (set in active environment).

Headers
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}
- Accept: application/json (optional; defaults to JSON)

Query Parameters (optional)
- sysparm_query: ServiceNow encoded query to filter results. Example: serial_number=GYXVDWYTHX^install_status=1
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return. Example: sys_id,display_name,serial_number,assigned_to
- sysparm_limit: Max records to return (default 10, max typically 10000). Example: 100
- sysparm_offset: Starting index for pagination. Example: 0
- sysparm_display_value: true|false|all to control display values.
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true to omit reference links.
- sysparm_query_category: Named query category if configured.

Successful Response
200 OK with body shape: { "result": [ { <alm_asset fields> } ] }
Common fields returned include: sys_id, display_name, serial_number, model, model_category, install_status, assigned_to, ci, company, location, purchase_date, warranty_expiration, retired.

Sample Response (truncated)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "00a43f231bfa2a108d5f64e1604bcb21",
      "display_name": "Dell Inc. Precision 5570",
      "serial_number": "60HCTT3",
      "install_status": "1",
      "model": { "value": "94543de387fea250dbd2fc89cebb3520" },
      "assigned_to": "",
      "ci": { "value": "6c74bbab873ae250dbd2fc89cebb35cd" }
    },
    {
      "sys_id": "00a43f231bfa2a108d5f64e1604bcb28",
      "display_name": "Apple MacBook Air (13-inch, M4, 2025)",
      "serial_number": "GYXVDWYTHX",
      "assigned_to": { "value": "d7647bab873ae250dbd2fc89cebb35eb" }
    }
  ]
}

Usage Notes
- Ensure the x-sn-apikey variable is set in the active environment 'x-sn-apikey'.
- Use sysparm_fields to minimize payload.
- Combine sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset for pagination.
- For human-readable values on references, set sysparm_display_value=true.

Error Responses
- 401/403: Authentication/authorization issues. Verify API key and role.
- 400: Invalid sysparm_* parameter.
- 429: Rate limit; retry with backoff.
- 500: Server error.

Related
- Collection: ServiceNow
- Folder: same as this request

Summary
Retrieve CMDB model categories from ServiceNow.

Endpoint
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/cmdb_model_category

Authentication
- Requires API key header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}
- Ensure the active environment contains a valid value for x-sn-apikey.

Headers
- x-sn-apikey: Required. API key for the ServiceNow instance.
- Accept: application/json (implicit)

Query Parameters (optional)
- sysparm_query: ServiceNow encoded query string to filter results.
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.
- sysparm_limit: Max number of records to return (default instance limit applies).
- sysparm_offset: Record offset for pagination.
- sysparm_display_value: true|false|all – whether to return display values.
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true|false – exclude reference links.

Sample Request
GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/cmdb_model_category?sysparm_limit=10
Headers:
  x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Successful Response
Status: 200 OK
Body shape: {
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "...",
      "name": "...",
      "product_type": "good|service",
      "asset_class": "...",
      "cmdb_ci_class": "...",
      ... other fields ...
    }
  ]
}

Notes
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts. You can add tests to validate status code and required fields (e.g., sys_id, name).
- The response in this workspace previously returned 200 with a populated result array, confirming access and API key validity.

Examples of Common Filters
- Only OOTB categories: sysparm_query=ootb_category%3Dy
- Search by name: sysparm_query=name%3DHardware
- Select fields: sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,cmdb_ci_class

Change Log
- 2025-11-18: Initial documentation added.

Summary
Retrieve CMDB model records from ServiceNow using the Table API. This request calls /api/now/table/cmdb_model to list model definitions in the CMDB.

How it works
- Method: GET
- URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/cmdb_model
- Auth: API key header x-sn-apikey is referenced from the active environment variable {{x-sn-apikey}}.

Usage
- Add query parameters to filter, sort, and paginate results (examples):
  - sysparm_query: encoded query to filter records (e.g., nameLIKElaptop^active=true).
  - sysparm_fields: comma-separated list of fields to return (e.g., name,manufacturer,model_number,sys_id).
  - sysparm_limit: max number of records to return (default 10, set higher to page).
  - sysparm_offset: record offset for pagination.
  - sysparm_display_value: true/false/all to control display values.
  - sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true to omit reference links.
  - sysparm_query_category: use saved queries by category if configured.

Notes
- Ensure the environment variable x-sn-apikey is set in the active environment.
- Response body is a JSON object with a result array of cmdb_model records.
- Avoid returning large payloads in prod by specifying sysparm_fields and reasonable limits.

Examples
- Filter by name and return key fields:
  ?sysparm_query=nameLIKElaptop&sysparm_fields=name,manufacturer,model_number,sys_id&sysparm_limit=50
- Get display values:
  ?sysparm_display_value=true

Title: Get Contract Rate Card by Contract sys_id

Summary:
Retrieves rate card records from the ServiceNow fm_contract_rate_card table filtered by a specific Contract (sys_id).

Endpoint:
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/fm_contract_rate_card

Query parameters:
- sysparm_query (required): contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>
  • Replace <CONTRACT_SYS_ID> with the target Contract record sys_id. You can also pass multiple conditions using ^ as the AND operator, e.g., contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>^active=true.

Headers:
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (required)
  • The value is read from the active environment variable x-sn-apikey.

Authorization:
This request uses an API key header (x-sn-apikey). Ensure the active environment contains a valid x-sn-apikey value with permissions to read fm_contract_rate_card.

Path and body:
- No path params.
- No request body is required for this GET.

Usage notes:
- If you expect data but receive an empty result (result: []), verify that:
  • The Contract sys_id is correct and exists.
  • Your API key has read access to fm_contract_rate_card.
  • The contract has associated rate card records.
  • Any additional filters in sysparm_query aren’t over-restrictive.
- To limit fields, you can add sysparm_fields, e.g., sysparm_fields=sys_id,contract,rate,unit.
- To page through large result sets, use sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset.

Example request:
GET /api/now/table/fm_contract_rate_card?sysparm_query=contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>
Header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Sample success response (200):
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<sys_id>",
      "contract": "<contract_sys_id>",
      "rate": "100.00",
      "u_currency": "USD",
      "unit": "hour",
      "active": "true"
    }
  ]
}

Error handling:
- 401/403: Invalid or missing API key. Confirm x-sn-apikey in the active environment.
- 400: Check sysparm_query syntax (use ^ for AND, = for equality; values should not include angle brackets).

Testing tips:
- Add tests to assert status code is 200 and that result is an array. Optionally assert that items have expected fields when present.

Overview
Retrieves contract instance records from ServiceNow’s ast_contract_instance table using the Table API. This request filters results by a specific contract sys_id.

Method & URL
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/ast_contract_instance?sysparm_query=contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>

Auth & Headers
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (required)

Variables
- {{x-sn-apikey}}: API key for your ServiceNow instance. Managed in the active environment.
- <CONTRACT_SYS_ID>: The sys_id of the parent contract record to filter instances by. Replace with a concrete sys_id value before sending.

Query Parameters
- sysparm_query: contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID> — Limits results to instances associated with the given contract. You can extend this query with additional encoded query terms if needed (e.g., ^active=true).

Typical Response (200)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<instance_sys_id>",
      "contract": "<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>",
      "number": "CNTINST000123",
      "state": "active",
      "start_date": "2024-01-01",
      "end_date": "2025-01-01"
      // ... other fields returned by the table schema
    }
  ]
}

Common Status Codes
- 200 OK: Request succeeded.
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid sysparm_query or malformed request.
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden: Missing or invalid x-sn-apikey. Ensure the variable is set in the active environment.
- 404 Not Found: Table or record not found for the provided sys_id.

Notes
- You can add additional sysparm_* parameters (e.g., sysparm_fields, sysparm_limit, sysparm_display_value) to control the shape and size of the response.
- Ensure the user or integration associated with the API key has read access to ast_contract_instance and related tables.

Examples
- Filter active instances only:
  sysparm_query=contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>^active=true
- Return display values instead of sys_ids:
  sysparm_display_value=true

Title: Get Suppliers Product Model

Overview:
Retrieves product model records from ServiceNow's CMDB Model table (cmdb_model). Use this endpoint to list, filter, and page through supplier product models stored in your ServiceNow instance.

HTTP
- Method: GET
- URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/cmdb_model

Authentication:
Requires an API key sent as an HTTP header. In this workspace, the header x-sn-apikey is used. Ensure your active environment provides a valid key.

Query Parameters:
- sysparm_query: Encoded query to filter results (e.g., nameLIKELaptop^manufacturer=Apple).
- sysparm_fields: Comma-separated list of fields to return (e.g., sys_id,name,manufacturer,model_number).
- sysparm_limit: Max records per page (default 10, max typically 10000).
- sysparm_offset: Starting record index for pagination (0-based).
- sysparm_display_value: true|false|all — return display values instead of raw sys_ids when applicable.
- sysparm_exclude_reference_link: true to omit reference links in the response.
- sysparm_query_category: Optional saved query category to apply in instance.
- sysparm_view: View to use for field visibility (advanced).
- sysparm_suppress_pagination_header: true to hide pagination headers from response.
- sysparm_no_count: true to skip total count calculation for performance.
- sysparm_sort: Field to sort by (e.g., name).
- sysparm_order: asc|desc — sort direction.

Pagination:
Use sysparm_limit and sysparm_offset to page through results. If available, inspect response headers for pagination hints.

Usage Notes:
- Set the x-sn-apikey header in the request (already configured).
- Use sysparm_fields to reduce payload size and improve performance.
- For complex filters, build a ServiceNow encoded query and pass it in sysparm_query.
- If you need related records resolved to display values, set sysparm_display_value=true.

Sample Request:
GET {{baseUrl}}/api/now/table/cmdb_model?sysparm_query=nameLIKELaptop&sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,manufacturer,model_number&sysparm_limit=25

Sample Response:
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<guid>",
      "name": "Laptop Model X",
      "manufacturer": "Acme",
      "model_number": "X-15"
    }
  ]
}

Error Codes:
- 401: Unauthorized – missing/invalid API key.
- 403: Forbidden – user lacks rights to read cmdb_model.
- 404: Not found – table or endpoint not available.
- 429: Too many requests – rate limit exceeded.

References:
- ServiceNow Table API docs: https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/reference/api/quebec/rest/c_TableAPI

Overview
Fetch ServiceNow service_offering records filtered by a specific vendor.

HTTP
- Method: GET
- URL: https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/service_offering

Query Parameters
- sysparm_query (required): Encoded ServiceNow query.
  - Used here to filter by vendor sys_id.
  - Example: sysparm_query=vendor=<VENDOR_SYS_ID>
  - Replace <VENDOR_SYS_ID> with the sys_id of the vendor record in your instance.

Authentication & Headers
- x-sn-apikey (required): {{x-sn-apikey}}
  - Ensure the active environment provides x-sn-apikey.
- Content-Type is not required for GET.

Path/Variable Notes
- This request uses a direct table API (service_offering).
- You can add additional ServiceNow query clauses, e.g.:
  - vendor=<VENDOR_SYS_ID>^active=true
  - nameLIKECompute

Sample Request
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/service_offering?sysparm_query=vendor=<VENDOR_SYS_ID>
Header: x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}}

Sample Response (trimmed)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "c0ffee...",
      "name": "Compute Service",
      "active": true,
      "vendor": "<VENDOR_SYS_ID>"
    }
  ]
}

Notes
- Requires roles/permissions on the ServiceNow instance to read service_offering.
- Use additional sysparm_* parameters as needed: sysparm_limit, sysparm_fields, sysparm_display_value.
- Example: &sysparm_limit=50&sysparm_fields=sys_id,name,vendor&sysparm_display_value=true

Summary
Retrieves asset-to-contract relationships from the ServiceNow clm_m2m_contract_asset table. This request filters the records by a specific Contract sys_id provided in the query.

Method and URL
GET https://illumindev.service-now.com/api/now/table/clm_m2m_contract_asset?sysparm_query=contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID>

Purpose
Use this to list assets linked to a particular contract (many-to-many mapping). Useful for inventory, compliance, and renewal workflows.

Auth and Headers
- x-sn-apikey: {{x-sn-apikey}} (environment variable required)

Path and Query Parameters
- sysparm_query (query): contract=<CONTRACT_SYS_ID> (required)
  - <CONTRACT_SYS_ID>: The sys_id of the Contract record to filter by.

Common Optional Query Params
You can append standard Table API params as needed, for example:
- sysparm_fields=field1,field2 to limit fields
- sysparm_limit=100 to control page size
- sysparm_offset=0 for pagination
- sysparm_display_value=true to return display values

Environment Variables
- {{x-sn-apikey}} must be set in the active environment.

Usage Notes
- Replace <CONTRACT_SYS_ID> with a valid Contract sys_id (e.g., from a prior Get Contracts call).
- Consider URL-encoding complex queries when expanding filters.

Example
GET .../api/now/table/clm_m2m_contract_asset?sysparm_query=contract={{MY_SYS_ID}}

Expected Response
- 200 OK with a JSON payload containing a result array of clm_m2m_contract_asset records.
- 401/403 if authentication is invalid or missing.

Sample 200 Response (truncated)
{
  "result": [
    {
      "sys_id": "<record_sys_id>",
      "contract": "<contract_sys_id>",
      "asset": "<asset_sys_id>",
      "u_active": true,
      "sys_created_on": "2024-01-15 12:34:56"
    }
  ]
}

Related Endpoints
- Get Contracts (if available in this workspace) to look up contract sys_ids.
